PARAGRAPH.STRING: , or just Ruapehu, is an active stratovolcano at the southern end of the Taupo Volcanic Zone in New Zealand.
is 23 kilometres northeast of Ohakune and 40 kilometres southwest of the southern shore of Lake Taupo, within Tongariro National Park. The North Island's major skifields and only glaciers are on
is one of the world's most active volcanoes and the largest active volcano in New Zealand.
is the highest point in the North Island and
includes three major peaks: Tahurangi (2,797 m), Te Heuheu (2,755 m) and Paretetaitonga (2,751 m). The deep, active crater is between the peaks and fills with a crater lake between major eruptions.
